website_summaries.verdict: This item is easy to install and filters outside odors. But it does not use baking soda or charcoal, so it will not be as effective on existing smells.
pros: Removes and filters 99.5% of all dust, pollen, air pollution, allergens, pet dander, and other airborne contaminants from the outside air before it reaches the vehicle's interior
Helps prevent premature wear on your car's HVAC system by promoting good airflow inside the car
cons: No charcoal, so it does not do much to remove existing smells

customer_reviews.title: Never let a shop talk you into letting them do this again -- easy, and you save about 80% off shop prices.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install. Don't EVER let a car place charge you $59.99 plus shop fees and tax to do a job you SHOULD be doing every six months, and you CAN do in about three minutes. Takes no tools, no car knowhow. Easy as pie. Catches smoke coming in from that a%% in front of you smoking with the windows open. Nice clean fresh air. Yours probably already is crapped up with leaves. Get one -- it 's easy. Google it on Youtube, then go do it. Mine was for a Honda Fit. Did it in 90 seconds, and that included dumping all the crap out of the glove box.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. B.

customer_reviews.title: Simple install for 2016 Civic
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and basically identical the the OEM filter it was replacing. Fit perfectly fine in a 2016 Civic EX.
customer_reviews.author: Cody S.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly, if not better than the one that came with my 2017 Honda Civic.
customer_reviews.text: Do not pay your dealer to change this cabin filter. Brought in for an oil change, my dealer wanted 99.99 to change the engine filter and the cabin filter. I said no thanks. Together both filters cost $25. That means the dealer was charging $75 for 10 minutes easy work to insert the filters. (YouTube it) Don't let anyone tell you that this filter is low end, or not as good as what came with your car. It's the same if not better. I should have taken a picture, but is exactly as shown on Amazon and came right on time.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Looks and performs just like the factory honda cabin air filter
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because the local Honda dealership wanted to charge me $64.99 to replace the cabin air filter! Knowing how easy this is to do yourself, i went ahead and purchased this aftermarket filter for a fraction of the cost....and it only takes about 60 seconds to do! I created a tutorial/how-to video on youtube for those who are interested, just search "How to Change a Cabin Air Filter on a 2016-2020 Honda Civic" on youtube and you'll see it. Best of luck and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, affordable replacement for 2015 Honda Fit EX
customer_reviews.text: I was previously buying replacement cabin air filters for my 2015 Honda Fit from Honda Direct but these are about half the cost and free shipping. The edges of this one seem a bit more flimsy than the genuine Honda filters and the lid for the filter box fit a little tighter over it, but it doesn't really matter. Otherwise the filter material seems to be of similar quality to the OEM.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Not what it’s supposed to be
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this item, I was under the impression this part was a genuine part for my car. I installed the filter only to find out later that this filter does not fit my vehicle. I took the car for a routine check up and dealer informed me of this. Waste of money. Replaced with a genuine OE filter. Not sure who is to blame for this. False information provided when I searched by vehicle type, model.
customer_reviews.author: Geordie

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 2016 Fit perfectly. A great value compared to the OEM filter.
customer_reviews.text: I saw a video on Youtube showing a cabin air filter change using this exact filter, so i had no issues installing it in my 2016 Fit. One thing to be aware of: orient the filter with the labeled side (the side with the text CHINA and the arrow) so that the arrow points down. Now rotate the filter 90 degrees so that the labeled side is facing either to the right or left when you put it in. If you try to install with the labeled side facing you, the filter will go in but will be too long front to back. Rotate it 90 degrees and re-insert. It should go all the way in.
customer_reviews.author: RichW

customer_reviews.title: Huge price increase and making them different
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same filter a year ago for $5, and now it is $12. I'll pass on reordering. In addition, they have now started adding three rows of plastic ribbing, and the result is that you have to snip off the ends of each ribbing so that it fits in the holder. So, extra work and more than double the price...pass on it. I just bought a Puroma charcoal 2-pack P set for $12.83. More value, and the picture doesn't show that they have ribbing down the middle that I need to remove in order to fit it in my Fit.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't quite fit the 2019 Honda Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: Honda OEM filter has a felt layer on left and right side of filter that allows for a snug fit and no leak through. The Ecogard does not have this, but has the same exterior dimensions as OEM at the edge of felt. Result is that the Ecogard does not have any "give" when being installed. After carefully pushing the filter about 2/3 of the way into the slot, it began to collapse under the pressure. I slowly worked the filter until I finally fully inserted it and I hope that it slid all the way to the back of the slot rather than just getting stuck 2/3-3/4 of the way in and being crushed.
customer_reviews.author: TheFixer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: had my 15k check on my 18-month-old vehicle and part of recommended service was replacing cabin filter -- I asked for the price and was told $50 -- I passed but began thinking it could not be that difficult to do myself -- I found instructions via youtube and replaced the filter -- could not believe how dirty it was -- I do not drive on dirt roads, etc so I can imagine what a filter subjected to that would look like
customer_reviews.author: Opus

customer_reviews.title: Saved me money and time.  Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 2016 Honda Civic which the dealer told me it needed replacement but I knew they would charge and arm and a leg so I decided to do it myself. Not only was it easy to put in thanks to YouTube. It saved me a lot of money and time waiting if I took it into the service dept. The filter I replaced was dirty and would leave a frito smell. Now my car has no smell and I did it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, affordable price, quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Though I have not yet installed the filter on my 2009 Honda Fit, its shape is the same as the filter currently installed; and the filtering material appears comparable to that filter. I noted on one website that Ecogard made a filter of similar materials for the Chevy Equinox; so I believe it will perform well. Even if I change it more frequently than the recommended 12,000 miles, at the price I paid, I can install two to three of these for the price of one of a more highly-advertised brand.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Asbury

customer_reviews.title: It's a little longer then a Honda filter.
customer_reviews.text: It hardly fit, had to stuff it in a little to make it fit. I have a 2017 Honda CR-V. I measured both filters one on top of each other to check size. The Ecogard was like one quarter inch longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. America

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy Install Fits 2009 Honda Fit Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This cabin air filter fits a 2009 Honda Fit perfecty with no modification necessary. I recommend you check your filter regularly. I live in a fairly clean area with no dust and my old filter was clogged with fir needles, cedar cones, and small leaves that somehow got into the filter. Changing the filter was very easy....just check youtube for a DIY video to see how to open the lower glove compartment. Need some advice now on how to install an aftermarket USB port in the glove compartment. Any advice?
customer_reviews.author: Cedarspring

customer_reviews.title: Took me 10 Mins to change cabin filter.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it took me 10 Mins to change cabin filter. This is for my 2017 Honda CRV with only 9,000 miles. The old filter was black from dirt, forget when dealer tells you change after 15,000 miles, plus they get $100.00 to change it. Cons: None.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Took 1 minute 23 seconds to replace; perfect for 2011 Fit
customer_reviews.text: My brother encouraged me to do this myself. Watched two videos. Took 1 minute 23 seconds to replace and that included emptying/replacing the contents of the glove compartment and taking the picture attached. Fit my 2011 Honda Fit perfectly. Just note that you want the arrow down and that side on the left when you replace.
customer_reviews.author: Althea

customer_reviews.title: Great price and works perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you can change your car's cabin filter yourself, this product will save you some cash vs having the dealer do it or buying the OEM part. This filter fits and work perfectly. You can find a "how to install" video on YouTube and you will see how easy it is. I would definitely recommend this item if you are a do it yourself person.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo10

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2018 Honda Odyssey.
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit 2018 Honda Odyssey. The Honda filter has felt to help slide it into the slot. The EcoGuard has very stiff sides and it will not slide into the slot. See pics of the Honda filter.
customer_reviews.author: denverdog

customer_reviews.title: Quality Filter
customer_reviews.text: Quality filter with good fit (2018 CR-V, 2.5) . Only thing I would mention is that the print on the filter (at least mine) is not on the front like the factory filter. I tried inserting with the print to the front unsuccessfully several times until I realized it is on the side. I turned the filter and it slid right in.
customer_reviews.author: JoeS

customer_reviews.title: Fits
customer_reviews.text: Most of the filters I have looked at states they fit the Honda Fit. I was a little worried that it would not fit, but it did actually fit my 2016 Honda HR-V AWD LX. I'm a senior lady who is not mechanically inclined but watched a video and it was easy to install under the glove box. I didn't realize that you had to change filters inside. I was seeing black type dust fibers coming thru there so hope this will fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit perfectly but fits well!
customer_reviews.text: This fits and seems to work well, but the fit isn't perfect. I've messed with an air filter or several hundred in my day, so a few millimeters will make the difference between a perfect and an imperfect fit (wherein the sides have to be smooshed or end up being crooked). Super easy installation: You basically smoosh the sides of the glove box so the whole thing swings down, then you pull the tabs on either side of the air filter box so you can remove the cover,
customer_reviews.author: Nat M. ZorachTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Worked in a Honda Fit!
customer_reviews.text: My niece installed this air filter without problem (around 15 minutes) in her Honda Fit after watching a DIY Youtube video. It will improve the interior cabin air quality and save you some money when using the A/C. Three stars because there are no instructions at all; the quality of the filter is ok. Be sure the "arrow" shown on the side of the square filter points up.
customer_reviews.author: MPN

customer_reviews.title: It's alright. I'm not crazy about it
customer_reviews.text: The filter is quite flimsy. It's not as easy to fit as the OEM. However, I think it's fair with the price. The only thing bothers me is the smell after i put it in. It smells like plastic-like. It took 2 weeks to get rid of that new smell. Tips: clean all the leaves, insect and dirts before you put he filter in.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to have keep your car air fresh and clean
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the easiest thing to install in my car. It makes such a difference especially when your previous air filter was not replaced in a while. And here is a little trick that I found out about car air filters. NEVER BUY air fresheners when you can buy essential oils in the scent that you desire and you can proceed to pour a little on your air filter to get scented air blowing out of all car vents rather than having an air freshener on one vent. I poured a bit of mint oil on my air filter and now my air smells clean and minty.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the cabin air filter I have in my 2016 Honda Civic. Whole process took 2 minutes from unboxing to installation, and it was literally 1/3 of the price the guys at the dealership tried to upsell me on it. As far as I can tell it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: What a deal!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these - it fits our 2016 Honda Civic and our 2012 Honda Fit. Replaced each filter - such dirty, disgusting filters - in less than five minutes. Immediately noticed a huge improvement in the cabin's air quality. DO NOT be intimidated by this simple job, and don't pay outrageous prices either. How long will they last? I don't know - but at ten bucks apiece, it isn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Student P

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, a little bit long
customer_reviews.text: This was a real easy installation and seems to be a good product. the only reason for 3 stars is because it does not fit perfectly. the length is a tiny bit long and i have to cut it to make it a little bit short. after that it was a breeze. if not for the slight misfit i would have easily given 4/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.D

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely NOT a fit for 2017 Honda Civic
customer_reviews.text: This filter is about a quarter inch TOO SMALL. It does not fit inside the housing ridges of the 2017 Civic. Its critical that it fit exactly within the ridges because that is the only way to seal tightly with the intake. If it does not fit tightly, tons of unfiltered air will enter the HVAC system. Buyer beware! The seller should update the description. Others have noted the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Not the right fit for 2018 Honda Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: This filter did not quite fit my 2018 Honda Odyssey EX-L. About 4mm too narrow and 4mm too long. Had to force it shut and I am not sure that’s the right thing to do. Can’t even return it now. Their Engine air filter was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: SSKV

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not great on a 2017 Honda CR-V
customer_reviews.text: The OEM Honda filter fits better (that's to be expected), seals tighter, and seems a notch or two better in manufacturing quality. I saved about $10 by going with the Ecogard. In retrospect, next time I will just buy an OEM filter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been ordering this product for a year now through subscribe and save. It is a great filter. Every time I take it out it is filthy which for a filter is a good thing means it is working. You will be pleased with this filter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pershing

customer_reviews.title: No reason to buy filters anywhere else
customer_reviews.text: I now buy all my Honda air/cabin air filters from Amazon. The are darned near a 1/3 of the price going to any auto parts store or even Walmart. Some Hondas are easier to install than others, but the quality/build looks to be just as good as any other .
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Waldrop

customer_reviews.title: exact fit
customer_reviews.text: Exact fit for the one in my Fit. Identical in size, shape and pleats to the Honda filter removed. 5 minutes install (3 to remove/replace all the junk in the glove compartment, 2 to remove/replace old filter and vacuum the well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell!
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this a try since the reviews were really good. My only complaint it that the sides weren’t reinforced as well as the manufacturers, but I’m sure it will do the trick. Especially since the manufacturer want to charge $50 to replace!! I’ll check back when it’s time to replace. For now, solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Teller

customer_reviews.title: Repeat buy, love it
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and save your money by changing your filters in your car your self. Most air filters take less than 5 minutes to change and you will save yourself almost a hundred dollars versus paying that to a dealership. This item is great and we purchase it throughout the year.
customer_reviews.author: J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A really easy filter to install
customer_reviews.text: Hard to tell if this works well, but I'm happy with the purchase. It arrived quickly and in perfect condition. The filter fits my 2016 Honda Civic Touring model perfectly, and it was incredibly easy to install. Don't let a mechanic do this for you; buy this and save yourself over $50.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Decided to order online instead of shopping at the local chain auto store. I purchased some brand from O'Reilly's auto parts and a couple months later, a mouse decided to use my vents and filter as nesting/toilet area. Now my car doesn't smell of mouse urine and fecal matter. Netter yet, this brand fits perfectly on my car and snaps tight into place; the one I got previous to this had to be stretched to fit in place.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Quicka and easy self install
customer_reviews.text: Easy Install did it in about 3 mins. The only thing to say would be is it's not as sturdy a little bitty soft and will be deforemd if you apply pressure while in packaging so be careful except for that fits well and can be replaced easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: For the price, shouldn't complain.
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn't seem to be as sturdy as oem. Fit seemed tight when trying to insert. Sides of the oem filter seems sturdier which holds up better to force when trying to insert the filter into the compartment.
customer_reviews.author: 19air

customer_reviews.title: Tried something new
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble looking for the FRAM brand in stores. So I checked amazon and came across this one here for a little cheaper than the brand I’m used to buying. So I figured I’d give it a try. I’ve been using it for about a month now and so far it’s doing a great job. I’d honestly order it again. If this current one lasts a decent amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Denni

customer_reviews.title: Easy easy easy
customer_reviews.text: Took less than 10 minutes to install. Dealer charges $65 for filter and to install it. If you don't know how to do it for your car - go to YouTube and enter your car model, year and "install cabin filter"
customer_reviews.author: nurse reader

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the dealer screw you
customer_reviews.text: Dirt cheap you might as well put one of these in before you go get your oil changed somewhere so the place can't say anything about your filter being. And try and up sell you on a $60 cabin air filter job
customer_reviews.author: Dan Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: I probably saved $40 replacing my car's cabin air filter myself.
customer_reviews.text: Having older brothers in the automotive business, one suggested I change my own cabin filter. I watched a quick video, went in thru my glove compartment & completed the task in 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Brand

customer_reviews.title: Equivalent to Honda OEM
customer_reviews.text: Quality is pretty good, very similar to Honda oem. Similar number of pleats, thickness, and surface area. Easy to install on new CR-V. Self explanatory when you open the glove box just squeeze the sides.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Definitely cheaper than Honda filter and performs just as well. This is my third one and first review of it. Never had a problem with them and they work well. Can’t ask for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Received. Filter was sealed in plastic bag inside of a cardboard box. Had the appropriate markings on it for direction of airflow etc. seemed to be better made than the oem Honda filter I removed
customer_reviews.author: MARIANNE

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like these. The same one fits both my '16 Civic and '16 HRV. Easy enough to install and saves a ton of money compared to the dealer or the ouils change shop.
customer_reviews.author: Jude24

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, great and fast delivery. Auto Parts wanted to charge me $34 just for the Cabin Filter and I bought both the Engine and Cabin filter from Ecogard for $20+. Awesome service and I always buy Ecogard for my cars.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Recommend a reuasble filter over this
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine. Installed in a 2016 Honda Civic. Not sure what is supposed to be 'Premium' about it. Just did a search and I would recommend the K&N washable and reusable filter. About 5 times the cost, but after seeing how nasty the filter was when I replaced it, it would be nice to clean it out every 10k.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: VERY REASONABLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: VERY REASONABLE PRICED PRODUCT. VERY EASY TO INSTALL. WATCH A YOUTUBE VIDEO AND YOU WILL SEE IT IS A PIECE OF CAKE. THE DEALER WANTED $84.00 FOR THE PART AND INSTALLATION.
customer_reviews.author: BIG D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy this was to install. I was a little nervous when I pulled the old one out [it didn't look quite the same as the old one I was taking out], but it fit well and the filter has made a HUGE difference in the air quality in the car.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: It fits and I sits
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, very affordable, its a filter... don't get ripped off by a mechanic... this is literally a 5 minute job if you don't know what you're doing. 1 min if you do.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Ecoguard cabin airfilter
customer_reviews.text: Appeared to be of good quality for a reasonable price. It replaced the OEM filter with complete accuracy of the fit. The filter material appeared to be of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Doc

customer_reviews.title: Dealer wanted $127 to replace this
customer_reviews.text: Honda dealer wanted $127 to replace this so I decided to just do myself (ridiculous). Watched a short YT video on install and it was a piece of cake. Took 5 mins.
customer_reviews.author: ab-global

customer_reviews.title: Used in a 2016 Honda Civic LX
customer_reviews.text: Although the filter is not as sturdy as the Honda OE brand, it is of very good quality. It fit my car just fine and you can't beat the price. It will do the job just fine. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alex F.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit odyssey 2018
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit 2018 odyssey. It physically fits length wise but not width wise. there were gaps on left and right sides of the filter compartment. Allowing unfiltered air to seep through the left and right sides. I would return the product but the original Honda filter was really dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Ditty D

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Filter. I have very minor allergies and this ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Filter. I have very minor allergies and this air filter is just as good as the original Honda filter but around 4x cheaper. Just remember it does not have charcoal so it will not get rid of any smells very well, but I bought this knowing that and am satisfied with this filter. Just for reference I put it in a 2016 Honda Fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly my 2009 Honda Fit
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! Fits the same as the manufactured filter but a lot cheaper. Really easy to install. You can research how to install on youtube if you're unsure.
customer_reviews.author: cindyr

customer_reviews.title: Install was a breeze! Fits 2018 honda civic ex
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this air cabin filter . It’s super easy to install.just follow the instructions and the arrow. And you’re all good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Bryan Aguas

customer_reviews.title: That it does not fit Honda CRV 2017-2019
customer_reviews.text: This is too large by about at least a half inch. It is not the same material as what I ordered and received last year. Have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: SteveT

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for 2017 Honda Civic Hatchback
customer_reviews.text: Fit well for my 2017 Honda Civic Hatchback. Took 5 minutes to install. Could have probably gotten it cheaper from other brands but Ecogard is a good brand and it still shipped on Prime time!
customer_reviews.author: laptopcustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and perfect fit for my Fit :) I am particular when it comes to quality on auto filters of any type, and I was very happy with these. And soooo easy to change out - save yourself some coin and do this service on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Troy A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: In my 10th gen civic this thing was a breeze to install. Looks identical to the stock unit and fit snuggly as a replacement. It's a cabin filter and I change them regularly, so I don't know how big a difference this one makes, but for the price I can't see anything else reasonably being a better buy. Would definitely recommend this product and I'll be buying again to replace my filter come the next go around.
customer_reviews.author: D Torre

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 2017 Honda CRV
customer_reviews.text: This for my 2017 Honda CRV perfectly! And was MUCH cheaper to buy here then to let the dealer charge me over $100. And it took only minutes to change!
customer_reviews.author: Special K

customer_reviews.title: Civic R 2019 cabin filters
customer_reviews.text: With all that wildfire 2 weeks ago, I had to change my cabin filters. Maybe its psychological but it feels good to have new filters.
customer_reviews.author: diamondtop

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy, and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Open glovebox and pinch sides to lower it further. Trickiest part was realizing that the part with the air flow down and other writing was not the front of the filter. I had to turn it so the writing was facing towards the driver side.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great product/price
customer_reviews.text: Great filter for the price. It fits perfect in my Honda Fit and is a fraction of the price of what the dealer charges. I also bought the engine filter and it is also just as good. I've replaced my filters twice now (once a year) and love these.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay dealer prices for an air filter
customer_reviews.text: ANYONE can install this filter. Ridiculous to pay 3 to 4 times the price to a dealer or mechanic. Do it yourself and save $$$.
customer_reviews.author: K. smith

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you put the filter in the correct way there are arrows on the sides.
customer_reviews.text: I watched a YouTube video and installed it myself! I bought an extra one so now my car doesn't stink like, meat and kids feet. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Marietta Cappelletti

customer_reviews.title: Fits good
customer_reviews.text: Works on all Honda Fit 2009-2013. I ordered these for multiple Fits and it's good. I'll probably buy more. Goes in behind the glovebox. Easy install
customer_reviews.author: midas81

customer_reviews.title: Good filter - bought two.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for replacing the factory filter on our car. Saved us a bunch of money doing it our self and not using OEM parts
customer_reviews.author: David Christensen

customer_reviews.title: You will be amazed at how much junk is on your old filter.
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't as easy to put in as the YouTube video showed. Not because of the filter itself but because of the clip on the Honda holder that is supposed to keep the filter in place.
customer_reviews.author: wee willie

customer_reviews.title: Easy DIY job
customer_reviews.text: Dealership wanted 65 bucks to replace the cabin air filter. Can you say ripoff? It took longer to empty the glove compartment than it did to replace the filter. The filter fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Great factory replacement
customer_reviews.text: Looks exactly like factory filter in my 2019 civic. Fit perfectly and great value. Will definitely buy again because I hate going part stores!
customer_reviews.author: khol

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works and fits like the original. Good to replace ever 9 months or every oil change to keep the cabin air fresh. You will be amazed at the amount of debris this thing can trap.
customer_reviews.author: GRJ_MIA

customer_reviews.title: Great clean air system
customer_reviews.text: High quality, clear & simple instructions, and reasonable price. Took me less than 10 minutes to replace old unit ... $saved lot$
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Not an exact fit
customer_reviews.text: 2018 Honda Odyssey. This filter was slightly oversize for the slot. Had to trim the two “hard” edges about 1/16” to get it to fit. Once that was done, it slid in fine and does what it’s supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: yippinyahoo

customer_reviews.title: Easy do it yourself replacement filter
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect and it's easy to install with no tools. It cost me about 20 less than the oil change place wanted to charge me. Save yourself some money and change the filter yourself in less than five minutes. Easy peasy
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for Hinda Civic Air Filters.
customer_reviews.text: So my Honda dealer wanted $120 to do this to my '16 civic and my girlfriend's '17 civic. $120 each! I bought this product and replaced both cars air filters in 15 minutes. Fits perfect. Works great. Installation could not be easier. Highly recommended. If this fits your car check out a youtube video, if it looks easy to do, buy it and save yourself some cash.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Alberts

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to avoid the high cost at the dealership, easy to installed and we saved a lot of money doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Harleyd

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The replacement cabin air filter from a local car parts dealer was $45.00. Yikes! This is exactly what I needed. The total cost came to less than $15.00 with the expense of shipping.
customer_reviews.author: raeinvenice

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2017 Honda CRV EX 1.5L
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit 2017 Honda CRV EX 1.5L. Buy the Ecoguard XA10498. Great air filters but don’t buy the wrong one.
customer_reviews.author: Lamarsnow3

customer_reviews.title: Fit my Honda just fine
customer_reviews.text: Husband had it installed in no time. Saved me $30 rather than having it replaced during an oil change.
customer_reviews.author: Radiant Mama

customer_reviews.title: Change it yourself and save a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: Filter was manufactured in China. Other than that, it fit perfectly and is so inexpensive that I can change on a regular basis. YouTube video showed how easy it was - to think that some dealers charge up to $100 to replace the cabin air filter!
customer_reviews.author: S. Kirksey

customer_reviews.title: Affordable alternative
customer_reviews.text: This filter is a great alternative to other cabin filters available for my wife’s Honda Fit. For $5 you can’t beat the price. Build quality is good, and the filter media is thicker than most without compromising air flow. Love this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: excellent item
customer_reviews.text: fits like it should. Even if you're not a doit yourself kind of person it was easy in my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver & Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: I was at Honda for my car’s service and they wanted to charge me $60+ for an air filter replacement. After watching a couple of YouTube vids on how to replace an air filter for a 2018 Civic Si sedan, I saved myself about $53 and it only took about two mins to DIY. Easy install and literally no tools needed except for a stepping stool cause sitting on the passenger seat would make you a bit high.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for cabin filter in a 2013 fit. The competition that advertised carbon in the filter is more expensive and it really didn't do much to eliminate environmental odor.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: fits as it should
customer_reviews.text: same size as the original. material seems similar. we'll see how much junk this one catches
customer_reviews.author: Matt Couch

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get dealer price gouged!
customer_reviews.text: Dealer charges $90 to replace it themselves! I charge myself shoe leather and some elbow grease!
customer_reviews.author: Cube Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter Right Price
customer_reviews.text: Better than OEM because it is linen white, not gray, so it is easy too see when it is dirty.
customer_reviews.author: JimLinda

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2019 Honda Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: The filter is about 1/8" too thick and jams in the slot. Also, OEM has 39 pleats where this one has 32.
customer_reviews.author: Oops409

customer_reviews.title: Identical to the one it replaced
customer_reviews.text: We change our own filters when the minder system gives the indication to do so, saves $100 between the 2 air filters compared to the dealer cost to do it for us.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Looks just like OEM
customer_reviews.text: I wish packs of paper weren't so much, but I guess it can't be free :) Filter arrived fast and slid perfectly in the slot (2017 CR-v cabin filter).
customer_reviews.author: zmonster8u

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit my 2016 Honda Fit
customer_reviews.text: This air filter is WAY bigger than what is meant to fit my 2016 Honda Fit. Ecoguard, I'd love an exchange for the correct size!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 2010 Honda Fit Sport
customer_reviews.text: Its a cabin air filter, so not much to say. Fits in my 2010 Honda Fit. Looked like it was decent quality. Good price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 2017 Honda CRV! I had ordered a different model for another online store that did not fit. I was so relieved this one fit my car. So easy to install, and 1/6 of the price quoted by the dealer! I’ll be ordering another in 20,000 miles!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy Another Brand
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and buy another brand. I was tempted by the Low price. Product should have stayed in China. In Short, flimsy, subpar quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: The shop wanted $42 parts & labor, I think I did okay with this one.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to go wrong with a $6 part and 5 min to install vs what a service shop would charge you.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch1inAZ

customer_reviews.title: Fits and Installs Easily
customer_reviews.text: The filter fits perfectly in my car. Easy to install, and costs much less than the Dealer Price.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

product_meta.title: ECOGARD XC36080 Premium Cabin Air Filter Fits Acura RDX 2019-2020, Honda Civic 2016-2019, CR-V 2017-2019, Fit 2009-2019, HR-V 2016-2019, Odyssey 2018-2020, Insight 2010-2019, Clarity 2017-2019
product_meta.description:
Size:One PackECOGARD XC36080 COMPATIBLE with 2009-2017 Honda Fit, 2016-2017 Honda Civic, 2016-2018 Honda HR-V, 2010-2014 Honda Insight, 2011-2015 Honda CR-Z, 2017 Honda CR-V. Replaces: FRAM CF11182 Purolator C36080 WIX 49101 OE 80292-TF0-G01. 

Ensure fit using ECOGARD's online catalog.

 ¥ Do you have a musty odor in your vehicle?
¥ Do you have allergies?
¥ Is your vehicle exposed to a large amount of road dust?

Try changing your cabin air filter. Installations, depeir filter. Installations, depending on your vehicle, can take as little as five minutes. Car manufacturers recommend changing your cabin air filter every 12,000-15,000 miles. If your vehicle is exposed to a considerable amount of road debris, ECOGARD recommends changing your cabin air filter once in the Spring and Fall. Custom installation instructions included with all cabin air filters which improves air quality in your vehicle by 99.5%. All products are designed with the installer in mind. We offer only premium cabin air filtering efficiency.

Electrostatic and carbon media
feature_bullets: COMPATIBLE with Acura RDX 2019-2020, Honda Civic 2016-2019, CR-V 2017-2019, Fit 2009-2019, HR-V 2016-2019, Odyssey 2018-2020, Insight 2010-2019, Clarity 2017-2019, Clarity HYBRID 2019-2019, CR-Z 2011-2015
REMOVES AND FILTERS 99. 5% of all dust, pollen, air pollution, allergens, pet dander, and other airborne contaminants from the outside air before it reaches the vehicle's interior.

HELPS PREVENT PREMATURE WEAR on your car's HVAC (air conditioning and heating) system blower by promoting good airflow inside the car. Replace per manufacturer recommendations or when existing cabin air filter inhibits airflow.
INSTALLS EASILY with included instructions - only takes a few minutes in most cars. Ensure fit using ECOGARD's online catalog.
